title: Heroic divers save whale and it stops to 'thank' them
text:
Heroic divers save whale and it stops to ‘thank’ them Lisa Trainer Monday 13 Mar 2017 5:04 pm To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video 
A team of heroic diving instructors saved a whale caught in a fishing net and then had the added satisfaction of being ‘thanked’ by the rescued mammal. 
The massive sperm whale was rescued by three diving coaches from South China’s Guangdong Province, who went on the mission by themselves. 
Impressed witnesses watched from the sidelines in their boats. AsiaWire Footage of the touching incident was filmed by the coaches themselves as they dived under the waves and approached the trapped whale. The animal had swum too close to shore, tangled itself in the large fishing net and only made matters worse by trying to wriggle free, causing the net to wrap around its head and fins. ‘It was only after we cut away some parts of the net from its body that it finally opened its mouth and I could yank the net out,’ said one of the rescuers. The entire net was successfully removed from the whale’s body and it was free to swim away. However, just as the rescuers expected the animal to leave, they were given a rather touching surprise in response – it stayed. The now viral video of the rescue shows the sperm whale lingering near the boats as if to say thank you, and it even shot some water out of its blowhole.
